DOC.brief_summary: Introduction : patient chronic back pain result degenerate disc disease , besides pain also present impaired gait . The purpose study evaluate clinical data use clinical rating scale , Oswestry Disability Index Greek version ( ODI ) , Numerical Pain Rating Scale low back pain leg pain ( NPRS ) Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire Greek Version , kinetic kinematic characteristic gait analysis patient chronic low back pain result degenerate disc disease ( Disc Degenerative Disease ) , application manual therapy technique . Methodology : purpose study , 75 patient suffer chronic low back pain randomly divide 3 group 25 . Each group receive five session first group receive manual therapy treatment ( spinal mobilisation ) , second sham treatment third , classic physiotherapy ( stretch exercise , TENS massage ) . To evaluate effectiveness treatment , visual analog pain scale , two questionnaire ( Oswestry Roland Morris ) also optoelectronic system record analysis gait ( kinetic kinematic data ) utilize .
DOC.brief_title: Gait Low Back Pain Patients After Spinal Mobilization
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize controlled trial compare efficacy spinal mobilization physiotherapy intervention ( stretch , TENS application Swedish type massage ) sham treatment group chronic low back pain patient . The outcome measure include three dimensional gait analysis ( kinetic kinematic data ) well clinical indicator ( numerical pain rating scale , Oswestry disability index , Roland-Moris Disability questionnaire ) .
DOC.criteria: low back pain 3 month recent lumbar MRI ( 12 month ) able walk without need walk aid leg length discrepancy 2 cm history spinal surgery history autoimmune disease history spondylolysis spondylolisthesis spinal fracture pregnancy respiratory and/or cardiac disease history stroke hip , knee ankle osteoarthritis cauda equina syndrome spinal inflammation spinal tumor steroid drug use last month osteoporosis
